enWisdom: Retribution is the fruit of misdeeds
Returning to sin [and repeating it] is persistence [in sinning]

Wisdom: إِنَّ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ قَدْ وَضَعَ الْعِقَابَ عَلَى مَعَاصِيهِ زِيَادَةً لِعِبَادِهِ عَنْ نَقِمَتِهِ
enWisdom: Verily Allah, the Glorified, has ordained punishment for committing sins against Him in order to save His servants from His chastisement
The one who sins knowingly does not deserve pardon
For the one who is bold in [committing] sins there are retributions from the chastisement of Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَحْتَمِي الطَّعَامَ لِأَذِيَّتِهِ كَيْفَ لَا يَحْتَمِي الذَّنْبَ لِأَلِيمِ عُقُوبَتِهِ
enWisdom: Vice is the endeavour of the filthy

Wisdom: لَنْ يَلْقَى جَزَاءَ الشَّرِّ إِلَّا عَامِلُهُ
enWisdom: None shall be punished for an evil act except its doer

Wisdom: لَيْسَ بِشَرٍّ مِنَ الشَّرِّ إِلَّا عِقَابُهُ
enWisdom: There is nothing worse than evil except its retribution
One who wrongs others brings upon himself a severe reprisal
One who is pleased by corruption is displeased by the Hereafter

Wisdom: مَنْ يَكُنِ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ خَصْمَهُ يُدْحِضْ حُجَّتَهُ وَيُعَذِّبْهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَمَعَادِهِ
enWisdom: One whose enemy is Allah, the Glorified, his proof is refuted and he is punished in this world and in his Hereafter
